CALL FOR PARTICIPATION

The 39th Edition of ECOOP

Bergen, Norway, 30th Jun - 4th July, 2025

https://2025.ecoop.org

ABOUT ECOOP
=============

ECOOP is Europe’s longest-standing annual Programming Languages
conference, bringing together researchers, practitioners, and students
to share their ideas and experiences in all topics related to
programming languages, software development, systems and applications.
ECOOP welcomes high quality research papers relating to these fields
in a broad sense.

ECOOP is committed to affordable open access publishing. Recent year’s
publications have been published by Dagstuhl’s LIPIcs series under a
Creative Commons CC-BY license where the authors retain their
copyright. ECOOP articles have been published without open access
publishing fee and can be accessed via a DOI. LIPIcs is indexed in
DBLP, Google Scholar, Scopus and others.

ECOOP 2025 will take place in Bergen, Norway, hosted by the Software
Engineering research group at Western Norway University of Applied
Sciences.

ECOOP Awards
=============

AITO Dahl-Nygaard Senior Prize
Mira Mezini
TU Darmstadt, Germany

AITO Dahl-Nygaard Junior Prize
Amir Shaikhha
University of Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Both prize winners will give a keynote at ECOOP.

Test-of-Time Award
Towards type inference for JavaScript
by Christopher Anderson, Paola Giannini, and Sophia Drossopoulou

Please visit https://2025.ecoop.org/track/ecoop-2025-awards to know
more about them.

ECOOP Keynote
=============

Petar Maksimovic (Nethermind and Imperial College London, United Kingdom)

Please visit https://2025.ecoop.org/news#Keynote-by-Petar-Maksimovic
for the details of the speaker.

Registration
==========

Detailed information about registration can be found at
https://2025.ecoop.org/attending/registration-information .

Deadlines:

  • Early registration: 28th May, 2025 (CEST).
  • Late registration: 22nd June, 2025 (CEST).

The week of ECOOP is high season in Bergen. We recommend to book
your accommodation as soon as possible.

Accepted Papers
=============

See https://2025.ecoop.org/info/accepted-papers for the list of
accepted papers.
